text: The Pit sculpin (Cottus pitensis) is a species of fish in the family Cottidae. It is found in the United States, inhabiting the Pit and upper Sacramento River systems in Oregon and California. It reaches a maximum length of 13.0 cm. It prefers rubble and gravel riffles. ==References== Category:Cottus (fish) Category:Fish described in 1963
title: Pit sculpin
